## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MailMessageEventArgs> class provides access to the <xref:System.Web.Mail.MailMessage> object that contains the e-mail message. Because the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MailMessageEventArgs> class is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginCancelEventArgs> class, you can cancel sending an e-mail message in your event handler by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginCancelEventArgs.Cancel%2A> property to `true`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Create a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MailMessageEventArgs> class when you want to pass a <xref:System.Net.Mail.MailMessage> object to an event handler that might modify the message before sending it.

## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MailMessageEventArgs.Message%2A> property returns the <xref:System.Web.Mail.MailMessage> object that contains the e-mail message data. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MailMessageEventArgs.Message%2A> property is read-only; however, you can use the <xref:System.Web.Mail.MailMessage> object that it returns to modify the properties of the e-mail message.
